TITLE: Using uvloop with Python 3.8+ (Preferred Method)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the recommended way to use uvloop by utilizing the uvloop.run() helper function to configure asyncio to use the uvloop event loop.
SOURCE: https://github.com/magicstack/uvloop.git/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import uvloop

async def main():
    # Main entry-point.
    ...

uvloop.run(main())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using uvloop with Python 3.11 and Earlier
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure uvloop for both Python 3.11+ using asyncio.Runner and earlier versions using uvloop.install(). Provides version-specific implementation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/magicstack/uvloop.git/blob/master/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import asyncio
import sys

import uvloop

async def main():
    # Main entry-point.
    ...

if sys.version_info >= (3, 11):
    with asyncio.Runner(loop_factory=uvloop.new_event_loop) as runner:
        runner.run(main())
else:
    uvloop.install()
    asyncio.run(main())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Manually creating and setting a uvloop event loop
DESCRIPTION: Python code to manually create a uvloop event loop instance and set it as the current asyncio event loop. This approach gives more control over when uvloop is used.
SOURCE: https://github.com/magicstack/uvloop.git/blob/master/docs/user/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import asyncio
import uvloop
loop = uvloop.new_event_loop()
asyncio.set_event_loop(loop)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting uvloop as the asyncio event loop policy
DESCRIPTION: Python code to set uvloop as the default event loop policy for asyncio. This approach automatically uses uvloop for all asyncio operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/magicstack/uvloop.git/blob/master/docs/user/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
import asyncio
import uvloop
asyncio.set_event_loop_policy(uvloop.EventLoopPolicy())
```
